intro: Diphysa occidentalis, commonly known as the western diphysa, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Diphysa occidentalis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for native insects.
